00001 /* bpred-alloyedperceptron.cpp: alloyed-history perceptron predictor
00002    [Jimenez and Lin, ACM TOCS 2002]     */
00003 /*
00004  * __COPYRIGHT__ GT
00005  */
00006 
00007 #include <math.h>
00008 #define COMPONENT_NAME "alloyedperceptron"
00009 
00010 #ifdef BPRED_PARSE_ARGS
00011 if(!strcasecmp(COMPONENT_NAME,type))
00012 {
00013   int l1_size;
00014   int his_width;
00015   int gbhr_width;
00016   int top_size;
00017 
00018   if(sscanf(opt_string,"%*[^:]:%[^:]:%d:%d:%d:%d",name,&gbhr_width,&l1_size,&his_width,&top_size) != 5)
00019     fatal("bad bpred options string %s (should be \"alloyedperceptron:name:gbhr_width:l1_size:lhis_width:top_size\")",opt_string);
00020   return new bpred_alloyedperceptron_t(name,gbhr_width,l1_size,his_width,top_size);
00021 }
00022 #else

00024 
00025 class bpred_alloyedperceptron_t:public bpred_dir_t
00026 {
00027 #define BIPOLAR(x) (((x)<<1)-1)
00028 //#define BIPOLAR(x) (2*(x)-1)
00029 
00030   class bpred_alloyedperceptron_sc_t:public bpred_sc_t
00031   {
00032     public:
00033     short* top_entry;
00034     short* ltop_entry;
00035     qword_t * lbhr;
00036     int sum;
00037     qword_t lookup_bhr;
00038   };
00039 
00040   protected:
00041 
00042   /* local hist */
00043   int bht_size;
00044   int bht_mask;
00045   qword_t * bht;
00046   /* global hist */
00047   int bhr_size;
00048   qword_t bhr;
00049 
00050   int top_size;
00051   short **top;  /* table of perceptrons */
00052   short **ltop; /* table of perceptrons */
00053   int weight_width;
00054   int weight_max;
00055   int weight_min;
00056   int threshold;
00057 
00058   int ghistory_length;
00059   qword_t ghistory_mask;
00060   int lhistory_length;
00061   qword_t lhistory_mask;
00062 
00063   public:
00064 
00065   /* CREATE */
00066   bpred_alloyedperceptron_t(char * const arg_name,
00067                             const int arg_ghistory_length,
00068                             const int arg_bht_size,
00069                             const int arg_lhistory_length,
00070                             const int arg_top_size
00071                            )
00072   {
00073     init();
00074 
00075     /* verify arguments are valid */
00076     CHECK_PPOW2(arg_bht_size);
00077     CHECK_NNEG(arg_ghistory_length);
00078     CHECK_NNEG(arg_lhistory_length);
00079     CHECK_NNEG(arg_top_size);
00080 
00081     name = strdup(arg_name);
00082     if(!name)
00083       fatal("couldn't malloc alloyedperceptron name (strdup)");
00084     type = strdup(COMPONENT_NAME);
00085     if(!type)
00086       fatal("couldn't malloc alloyedperceptron type (strdup)");
00087 
00088     bht_size = arg_bht_size;
00089     bht_mask = arg_bht_size-1;
00090     lhistory_length = arg_lhistory_length;
00091     lhistory_mask = (((qword_t)1)<<arg_lhistory_length)-1;
00092     ghistory_length = arg_ghistory_length;
00093     ghistory_mask = (((qword_t)1)<<arg_ghistory_length)-1;
00094 
00095     top_size = arg_top_size;
00096 
00097     /* see Dan Jimenez's HPCA paper for these magic formulae */
00098     threshold = (int)rint(floor(1.93*(ghistory_length+lhistory_length+1) + 14.0));
00099 
00100     /* if power of two, then actually need an extra bit to represent.
00101        also add one bit for the sign. */
00102     if(threshold == (1<<log_base2(threshold)))
00103       weight_width = log_base2(threshold)+2;
00104     else
00105       weight_width = log_base2(threshold)+1;
00106 
00107     weight_max = (1<<(weight_width-1))-1;
00108     weight_min = -(1<<(weight_width-1));
00109 
00110     bht = (qword_t*) calloc(bht_size,sizeof(*bht));
00111     if(!bht)
00112       fatal("couldn't malloc alloyedperceptron BHT");
00113     top = (short**) calloc(top_size,sizeof(*top));
00114     ltop = (short**) calloc(top_size,sizeof(*ltop));
00115     if(!top || !ltop)
00116       fatal("couldn't malloc alloyedperceptron ToP");
00117     for(int i=0;i<top_size;i++)
00118     {
00119       top[i] = (short*) calloc(ghistory_length,sizeof(*top[i]));
00120       if(!top[i])
00121         fatal("couldn't malloc alloyedperceptron ToP entry");
00122       ltop[i] = (short*) calloc(lhistory_length+1,sizeof(*ltop[i]));
00123       if(!ltop[i])
00124         fatal("couldn't malloc alloyedperceptron ToP entry");
00125     }
00126 
00127     bits = ghistory_length + bht_size*(lhistory_length)
00128          + top_size*(ghistory_length+lhistory_length+1)*weight_width;
00129   }
00130 
00131   /* DESTROY */
00132   ~bpred_alloyedperceptron_t()
00133   {
00134     for(int i=0;i<top_size;i++)
00135     {
00136       free(top[i]); top[i] = NULL;
00137       free(ltop[i]); ltop[i] = NULL;
00138     }
00139     free(ltop); ltop = NULL;
00140     free(top); top = NULL;
00141     free(bht); bht = NULL;
00142   }
00143 
00144   /* LOOKUP - loops unrolled by factor of 2.  This code takes a fair amount of
00145      time, and so we'll do what we can to speed it up. */
00146   BPRED_LOOKUP_HEADER
00147   {
00148     class bpred_alloyedperceptron_sc_t * sc = (class bpred_alloyedperceptron_sc_t*) scvp;
00149     int l1index = PC&bht_mask;
00150     bool pred;
00151     int top_index = PC%top_size;
00152     int x1; /* temporary */
00153     int y1; /* temporary */
00154 
00155     sc->lbhr = &bht[l1index];
00156     sc->top_entry = top[top_index];
00157     sc->ltop_entry = ltop[top_index];
00158     sc->sum = 0;
00159     sc->updated = false;
00160 
00161     for(int i=0;i<ghistory_length;i++)
00162     {
00163       /* add top_entry[i] if bit i in bhr is a one, subtract if zero */
00164       /* This is what one iteration used to do:
00165          if((*sc->bhr>>i)&1)
00166            sc->sum += sc->top_entry[i];
00167          else
00168            sc->sum -= sc->top_entry[i];
00169        */
00170       x1 = ((bhr>>i)&1);
00171       y1 = ((x1-1)^sc->top_entry[i])+(1-x1);  /* cond. negative: gives 2's complement if x1==0 */
00172       sc->sum += y1;
00173     }
00174     for(int i=0;i<lhistory_length;i++)
00175     {
00176       /* add top_entry[i] if bit i in bhr is a one, subtract if zero */
00177       /* This is what one iteration used to do:
00178          if((*sc->bhr>>i)&1)
00179            sc->sum += sc->top_entry[i];
00180          else
00181            sc->sum -= sc->top_entry[i];
00182        */
00183       x1 = ((*sc->lbhr>>i)&1);
00184       y1 = ((x1-1)^sc->ltop_entry[i])+(1-x1);  /* cond. negative: gives 2's complement if x1==0 */
00185       sc->sum += y1;
00186     }
00187     sc->sum += sc->ltop_entry[lhistory_length]; /* last entry corresponds to w_0, i.e. the bias */
00188 
00189     pred = sc->sum >= 0;
00190     sc->lookup_bhr = bhr;
00191 
00192     BPRED_STAT(lookups++;)
00193 
00194     return pred;
00195   }
00196 
00197 
00198   /* UPDATE */
00199   BPRED_UPDATE_HEADER
00200   {
00201     class bpred_alloyedperceptron_sc_t * sc = (class bpred_alloyedperceptron_sc_t*) scvp;
00202     int y_out;
00203     int t = BIPOLAR(outcome); /* make bipolar */
00204     int x; /* temporary */
00205     int diff;
00206 
00207     if(!sc->updated)
00208     {
00209       BPRED_STAT(updates++;)
00210       BPRED_STAT(num_hits += our_pred == outcome;)
00211       sc->updated = true;
00212     }
00213 
00214     /*
00215     if(sc->sum > threshold)
00216       y_out = 1;
00217     else if(sc->sum<-threshold)
00218       y_out = -1;
00219     else
00220       y_out = 0;
00221     */
00222     y_out = (sc->sum > threshold) - (sc->sum<-threshold);
00223 
00224     /* don't need to optimize this too much, since this code
00225        doesn't get called after the perceptron has ``finished''
00226        training */
00227     if(y_out != t)
00228     {
00229       for(int i=0;i<ghistory_length;i++)
00230       {
00231         //diff = t*BIPOLAR((*sc->bhr>>i)&1);
00232         x = ((sc->lookup_bhr>>i)&1);
00233         diff = ((x-1)^t)+(1-x);
00234         if(diff > 0)
00235         {
00236           if(sc->top_entry[i] < weight_max)
00237             sc->top_entry[i] ++;
00238         }
00239         else
00240         {
00241           if(sc->top_entry[i] > weight_min)
00242             sc->top_entry[i] --;
00243         }
00244       }
00245       for(int i=0;i<lhistory_length+1;i++)
00246       {
00247         if(i < lhistory_length)
00248         {
00249           //diff = t*BIPOLAR((*sc->bhr>>i)&1);
00250           x = ((*sc->lbhr>>i)&1);
00251           diff = ((x-1)^t)+(1-x);
00252         }
00253         else /* w_0 */
00254           diff = t;
00255         if(diff > 0)
00256         {
00257           if(sc->ltop_entry[i] < weight_max)
00258             sc->ltop_entry[i] ++;
00259         }
00260         else
00261         {
00262           if(sc->ltop_entry[i] > weight_min)
00263             sc->ltop_entry[i] --;
00264         }
00265       }
00266     }
00267 
00268     *sc->lbhr = ((*sc->lbhr<<1)|outcome)&lhistory_mask;
00269     bhr = ((bhr<<1)|outcome)&ghistory_mask;
00270   }
00271 
00272   /* SPEC_UPDATE */
00273   BPRED_SPEC_UPDATE_HEADER
00274   {
00275     BPRED_STAT(spec_updates++;)
00276     bhr = (bhr<<1)|our_pred;
00277   }
00278 
00279   /* RECOVER */
00280   BPRED_RECOVER_HEADER
00281   {
00282     class bpred_alloyedperceptron_sc_t * sc = (class bpred_alloyedperceptron_sc_t*) scvp;
00283     bhr = (sc->lookup_bhr<<1)|outcome;
00284   }
00285 
00286   /* FLUSH */
00287   BPRED_FLUSH_HEADER
00288   {
00289     class bpred_alloyedperceptron_sc_t * sc = (class bpred_alloyedperceptron_sc_t*) scvp;
00290     bhr = sc->lookup_bhr;
00291   }
00292 
00293   /* REG_STATS */
00294   BPRED_REG_STATS_HEADER
00295   {
00296     bpred_dir_t::reg_stats(sdb,core);
00297 
00298     int id = core?core->current_thread->id:0;
00299     char buf[256];
00300     char buf2[256];
00301 
00302     sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.threshold",id,name);
00303     sprintf(buf2,"%s training threshold",type);
00304     stat_reg_int(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &threshold, threshold, NULL);
00305     sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.weight_width",id,name);
00306     sprintf(buf2,"%s weight/counter width in bits",type);
00307     stat_reg_int(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &weight_width, weight_width, NULL);
00308   }
00309 
00310   /* GETCACHE */
00311   BPRED_GET_CACHE_HEADER
00312   {
00313     class bpred_alloyedperceptron_sc_t * sc = new bpred_alloyedperceptron_sc_t();
00314     if(!sc)
00315       fatal("couldn't malloc alloyedperceptron State Cache");
00316     return sc;
00317   }
00318 
00319 };
00320

00322 #endif /* BPRED_PARSE_ARGS */
